title: Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital | Updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi air pollution: AQI back to ‘severe’ as cold wave continues to grip national capital

Date: Dec 22, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi has deteriorated back to the ‘severe’ category with a recorded AQI of 427, coinciding with a cold wave affecting the national capital.

  • Delhi’s AQI has dropped to 'severe' levels, significantly impacting health.
  • Minimum temperature recorded at 8 degrees Celsius on Sunday.
  • Cold wave has led to an increase in smog conditions in the city.
  • Health experts recommend staying indoors, particularly for vulnerable groups.
  • The 24-hour average on Saturday was 370, categorized as 'very poor'.
  • Air quality has become the worst since December 2021.
"People without roofs were seen taking shelter at camps and tents arranged for them in Delhi during the winter season."

This latest spike in pollution levels has raised concerns among health authorities and led to recommendations for minimizing outdoor activities.
newTitle: Delhi Air Pollution Hits Severe Levels Amid Cold Wave

title: Rohit Sharma hit on the left knee while batting in the nets at the MCG - The Times of India
summary:

Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma was hit on the left knee while batting in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground during a training session.

  • Rohit Sharma faced throwdowns and continued to play for a while before seeking medical attention.
  • The physiotherapist applied an ice pack to his knee amid visible pain.
  • The incident did not appear serious; precautions are being taken to reduce any swelling.
  • Other players participated vigorously, including Jasprit Bumrah and Virat Kohli.
  • The fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy begins on December 26, with the series currently tied at 1-1.
“Such blows are common when you play cricket... I think this wicket was for white ball which is why the ball was staying low.” - Akash Deep

As the Indian team prepares for the upcoming Test, they remain hopeful for Sharma's quick recovery.

Donald Trump transfers nearly $4 billion worth of his Trump Media shares to revocable trust | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Donald Trump Transfers Nearly $4 Billion Worth of Trump Media Shares to Revocable Trust

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

US President-elect Donald Trump has transferred all his stake in Trump Media & Technology worth over $4 billion to a revocable trust of which he is the sole beneficiary.

  • Trump transferred 114.75 million shares, representing 53% of the company’s stock, as a “bona fide gift” to the Donald J. Trump Revocable Trust.
  • Trump’s son, Donald Trump Jr., is the sole trustee with voting and investment power.
  • Trump previously stated he had no intention of selling his shares in the company.
  • Trump Media was created after Trump's social media ban following the January 6 Capitol riot.
  • The company went public on NASDAQ in March 2024, with shares experiencing volatility.
  • As of Friday, Trump Media shares were down about 2% at $34.71.
“Trump Media shares have remained volatile and the stock touched intraday highs near $80 on the first day of trading.”

In conclusion, the transfer of shares to a revocable trust might indicate a strategic financial maneuver by Trump, though the reasons remain unclear.
newTitle: Donald Trump Transfers Nearly $4 Billion Worth of Trump Media Shares to Revocable Trust

title: Robin Uthappa breaks silence after arrest warrant issued against him in EPF deposits fraud case: 'Had no role...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Robin Uthappa Addresses Arrest Warrant in EPF Fraud Case

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has spoken out after an arrest warrant was issued against him regarding an alleged fraud involving Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) deposits, claiming he had no executive role in the companies involved.

  • Uthappa asserts he was a director due to financial contributions but not involved in day-to-day operations.
  • The arrest warrant was issued for failure to remit dues impacting workers' provident fund accounts.
  • Uthappa is currently residing in Dubai with his family.
“Regrettably, these companies failed to repay the funds I lent them, leading me to initiate legal proceedings.”

This situation has drawn significant attention, especially due to the implications for affected workers and the legal proceedings that will follow.
newTitle: Robin Uthappa Addresses Arrest Warrant in EPF Fraud Case

GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts - Hindustan Times
summary:
GST Council hikes tax on used, old EV cars by businesses; Opposition reacts

Date: Dec 22, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, has approved an increase of the tax rate on used electric vehicles sold by businesses from 12% to 18%. This decision aims to align used EV tax rates with those of non-electric vehicles.

  • The tax applies only to the margin value of sales by businesses.
  • Individual sellers remain exempt from this tax.
  • The decision faced criticism from opposition leaders, asserting it's unfavorable to the middle class.
  • Arvind Kejriwal criticized the move, stating it damages the aspirations of middle-class families.
  • Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of creating an uncertain business environment with frequent GST changes.
“Purchasing a car is a big deal for an ordinary middle-class family, but the central government is crushing their dreams...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The GST Council's decision reflects a broader strategy to regulate the used electric vehicle market in India, impacting businesses significantly while continuing to shield individual transactions.
newTitle: GST Council Increases Tax on Used Electric Vehicles; Opposition Responds

title: Australian media misbehaves with Team India, spreads absurd lies about Ravindra Jadeja: Here's what actually happened - Hindustan Times
summary:
Australian Media Misbehaves with Team India, Spreads Absurd Lies About Ravindra Jadeja

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: HT Sports

The article debunks false claims made by the Australian media regarding Ravindra Jadeja's press conference, where he was accused of refusing to answer questions in English. It provides a detailed clarification of the events, countering misleading statements and highlighting the rudeness displayed by some Australian journalists.

  • The Australian media falsely claimed that Jadeja refused to answer questions in English.
  • In reality, Jadeja answered questions in Hindi, as they were posed in that language.
  • Another claim suggested Jadeja had to leave for the team bus, which he never said.
  • The press conference was primarily for Indian media, which was communicated beforehand.
“At no stage did Jadeja refuse to answer in English.”

This controversy comes amidst growing tensions surrounding the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, now tied at 1-1, highlighting not just on-field rivalries but off-field frictions as well.
newTitle: Australian Media Misreports on Ravindra Jadeja During Border-Gavaskar Trophy

summary:

This article discusses a significant ruling by a US judge holding Israel's NSO Group responsible for the hacking of WhatsApp using the controversial Pegasus spyware. The decision marks an important moment in the ongoing battle over digital privacy and cybersecurity.

  • The US judge concluded that NSO Group was liable for hacking WhatsApp users.
  • This ruling could have lasting implications for the use of malware and surveillance technologies.
  • The case raises broader questions about accountability in the tech industry.
“This ruling demonstrates that even powerful surveillance companies can be held accountable for their actions.”

The verdict could pave the way for more stringent regulations on surveillance technologies and increased awareness of user privacy rights.

title: Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea - News18
summary:
Video: Car Flips 8 Times But Five Passengers Come Out Unscathed. Their Priority? Tea

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: News18

In a miraculous escape, five passengers were unhurt after their car flipped eight times in an accident on a highway in Rajasthan’s Nagaur. The incident, captured on CCTV, shows the car speeding before losing control.

  • The car flipped eight times after taking a sharp turn.
  • All five passengers were unhurt, with not even a single scratch reported.
  • After the crash, the passengers went into a showroom and asked for tea.
“No one was hurt…not even a single scratch. As soon as they entered, they asked for tea.” - Official from the car agency

This incident highlights the bizarre nature of the accident and the unscathed passengers' unusual priority.
newTitle: Five Passengers Survive Car Flip, Prioritize Tea

title: Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest - News18
summary:
Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa has been accused of failing to pay provident fund dues for employees of his company, Centaurus Lifestyle Brands Pvt Ltd., totaling Rs 23,36,602. A regional PF commissioner has requested his arrest.

  • Uthappa has reportedly not paid dues to employees.
  • The complaint was filed by the KR Puram branch's PF commissioner.
  • An arrest warrant has been sought under various acts related to tax recovery and provident fund violations.
  • Uthappa resides in Dubai, complicating the legal process.
  • A previous court ruling had stayed proceedings against Uthappa's apparel brand in a separate cheque bounce case.
"Uthappa was in violation of various sections of the Employees’ Provident Funds & Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952."

This situation raises concerns about the legal obligations of business owners and the potential repercussions of failing to manage employee benefits properly.
newTitle: Trouble For Ex-India Cricketer Robin Uthappa As Regional PF Commissioner Alleges Fraud, Seeks Arrest

title: Maharashtra portfolio allocation: Fadnavis keeps home department | Full list of ministers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Maharashtra Chief Minister Allocates Ministerial Portfolios

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Hindustan Times

On Saturday, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis allocated portfolios to his council of ministers, retaining the Home Department among other key ministries.

Key Points

  • Devendra Fadnavis retained the Home Department and took on Energy, Law and Judiciary, General Administration, and Information & Publicity departments.
  • Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde was allocated Urban Development along with Housing and Public Works.
  • NCP Chief Ajit Pawar received Finance and Planning as well as State Excise departments.
  • The full list of ministers and their assigned portfolios has been detailed.

Notable Quotes

“Maharashtra is entering a new phase with this cabinet formation,” said Fadnavis.

This cabinet reshuffle marks a significant reorganization of responsibilities within state governance, with implications for various sectors.

Overall, this portfolio allocation shapes the future governance and administrative strategies of Maharashtra.
newTitle: Maharashtra Chief Minister Allocates Ministerial Portfolios
